questions.question: I lent ……………………… my pen.
questions.description: When the indirect object goes before the direct object, there is no preposition.

questions.question: The old man told ………………………… the whole story.
questions.description: There is no preposition between tell and its objects.

questions.question: Show ………………………. your hands.
questions.description: When the indirect object goes before the direct object, there is no preposition.

questions.question: I lent my pen ………………………
questions.description: When the direct object goes before the indirect object, we put a preposition between them.

questions.question: She made coffee ……………………….
questions.description: When the direct object goes before the indirect object, we put a preposition between them.

questions.question: She washed the plates ………………………
questions.description: Here the correct pattern is subject + verb + noun/pronoun + adjective. In this case, the adjective denotes a state that results from the action expressed by the verb.

questions.question: You have made the walls …………………….

questions.question: He has finished ………………………
questions.description: The verb finish is usually followed by an ing form.

questions.question: I suggest ……………………….. travel insurance.
questions.description: Suggest cannot be followed by a to-infinitive. We use an ing form instead.

questions.question: You must not miss ……………………… him.
questions.description: After miss, we use an ing form.
